description: A mountain region where the disaster caused perpetual winter. Emphasizes temperature survival, puzzle-solving over combat, and ancient mysteries. No time pressure - rewards methodical exploration.
theme: endurance, ancient secrets, warmth as precious resource, preparation over urgency

design_philosophy.contrast_with_other_regions: Unlike Sunken District's frantic dual-rescue and Beast Wilds' commitment-driven urgency, Frozen Reaches rewards patient exploration. No dying NPCs. The salamanders are fine without player help.
design_philosophy.environmental_pressure: Cold creates tension and resource management without time limits. Hot Springs provide sanctuary for planning.
design_philosophy.puzzle_over_combat: Golem encounters have multiple peaceful solutions. Combat IS possible but deliberately punishing - 'hard mode' for players who insist.
design_philosophy.telescope_as_reward: Completing the telescope provides strategic information about ALL other regions, creating value for players who explore here first.

frozen_pass.name: Frozen Pass
frozen_pass.description: Entry point through the mountains. Biting cold, but survivable with basic preparation.

environmental_storytelling.frozen_travelers: Peaceful faces - they died in their sleep as the cold took them
environmental_storytelling.evacuation_signs: Signs of rushed departure years ago

hot_springs_refuge.name: Hot Springs Refuge
hot_springs_refuge.description: Volcanic pocket of warmth amid the frozen wasteland. Safe sanctuary for recovery and planning.

hot_springs.effect: Bathing restores health (5 per turn), instantly cures hypothermia

hot_springs_refuge.design_note: This serves as the region's 'safe haven' - no time pressure, player can plan and recover. Salamanders provide social element without urgency.

ice_caves.name: Ice Caves
ice_caves.description: Natural cave system with treacherous footing and extreme cold. Contains valuable treasures requiring preparation to retrieve.

main_chamber.description: Crystal blue walls, breath freezing instantly

deep_section.description: Deeper passages with thin ice over dark water

side_passage.description: Easy to miss - not on main path

temple_sanctum.name: Temple Sanctum
temple_sanctum.description: Ancient temple guarded by Stone Golems. Cold but sheltered from wind.

side_chamber.description: Small alcove, easy to miss during initial panic

cover_system.stone_pillars: 80% damage reduction when using as cover
cover_system.usage: Must explicitly use pillar for cover - not automatic

guardian_behavior.threshold_pause: Guardians won't attack player standing in doorway - allows observation
guardian_behavior.activation: Triggered by entering main hall without password/offering/crystal

frozen_observatory.name: Frozen Observatory
frozen_observatory.description: High peak with clear view of all regions. Extreme cold limits exposure time.

component_sources.crystal_lens: Ice Caves (frozen in wall, requires heat to extract)

reveals: NPC states in all regions (Aldric's campfire burning, Sira injured on trail, tapping from Delvan's building, movement in Garrett's caves)
Waystone repair requirements (five slots, one per region)
Hidden paths not visible from ground

features.view: Can see all regions even without telescope - Nexus, forests, water, fungal glow, distant smoke

traits: wind trying to tear you away

stone_golem_1.name: Stone Guardian
stone_golem_1.description: A massive humanoid of carved stone, runes glowing along its limbs.

transitions.guarding->hostile: Player enters main hall without valid authorization
transitions.any->guarding: Player leaves and returns (if passive or serving, remembers player)

password.phrase: Fire-that-gives-life and water-that-cleanses, united in purpose
password.effect: Guardians become passive - allow passage but don't serve

control_crystal.location: Ice Caves side passage (hidden, requires thorough exploration)
control_crystal.extraction: Frozen in wall - requires heat source
control_crystal.effect: Full control - guardians serve player, bow, await orders
control_crystal.limitation: Guardians still won't leave temple even when serving

ritual_offering.effect: Guardians recognize ancient protocol, become passive

combat_analysis.difficulty: Extremely hard - designed to discourage direct combat
combat_analysis.resources_required: Multiple healing potions, good weapon, cold resistance
combat_analysis.design_note: Combat is intentionally punishing. Puzzle solutions are clearly preferable.

stone_golem_2.name: Stone Guardian
stone_golem_2.description: A massive humanoid of carved stone, identical to its partner.
stone_golem_2.notes: Shares state with golem_1 - if one is deactivated/pacified, both are. If one is destroyed, other continues alone.

steam_salamander_1.name: Steam Salamander
steam_salamander_1.description: A lizard-like creature wreathed in steam. It regards you with glowing ember eyes.

heated_stone.description: Salamander breathes on stone, creating portable warmth

companion_benefits: Warmth aura: cold immunity when nearby (indefinite)
Can melt ice/provide heat on demand

companion_restrictions.reason: Elemental conflict - water extinguishes fire creatures

examples: Points at torch, then at self = wants fire
Shakes head at ice crystals = doesn't want cold things
Two fists coming together, then separating = temple guardians (warning)
Shivering gesture, then holding something close = caves have something valuable but cold

steam_salamander_2.name: Steam Salamander
steam_salamander_2.notes: Becomes friendly when salamander_1 becomes friendly. Won't become companion - stays at springs.

cold_weather_gear.name: cold weather gear
cold_weather_gear.description: Heavy furs and insulated clothing left by previous travelers.
cold_weather_gear.effect: Halves hypothermia accumulation in cold/freezing zones (not extreme)

preserved_supplies.name: preserved supplies
preserved_supplies.description: Frozen food and useful materials, still usable.

partial_map.name: partial map
partial_map.description: A torn map showing the Frozen Reaches with handwritten notes.

reveals.note: 'The springs saved my life. The temple took my partner's.'

ice_crystals.name: ice crystals
ice_crystals.description: Beautiful crystals that never melt, infused with cold magic.
ice_crystals.acquisition: Easy - can chip multiple free from walls

frost_lily.name: frost lily
frost_lily.description: A delicate white flower that thrives in extreme cold.
frost_lily.use: Trade item for Bee Queen in Beast Wilds

ice_shard.name: ice shard
ice_shard.description: A fragment of magical ice that pulses with cold energy.

solutions: Test ice carefully and find safe route

ice_shard.use: Required for waystone repair in Nexus

crystal_lens.name: crystal lens
crystal_lens.description: A precisely ground lens, frozen into an ice wall.

acquisition.challenge: Frozen in ice - requires careful extraction
solutions: Melt with fire source (heated stone, salamander, torch)

control_crystal.name: control crystal
control_crystal.description: A crystal that resonates with the golems' enchantments.
control_crystal.location: ice_caves (side passage - hidden, not on main path)

acquisition.discovery: Requires thorough exploration OR hint from temple inscriptions
acquisition.extraction: Frozen in wall, requires heat source

control_crystal.use: Full control over temple guardians (they serve rather than merely permit)
control_crystal.design_note: This is the 'best' solution but hardest to find. Rewards thorough exploration.

mounting_bracket.name: mounting bracket
mounting_bracket.description: A metal bracket inscribed with alignment runes.
mounting_bracket.acquisition: Requires getting past guardians (passive or destroyed)

cold_resistance_cloak.name: cold resistance cloak
cold_resistance_cloak.description: A cloak woven with protective enchantments against cold.
cold_resistance_cloak.design_note: Major reward for solving temple. Significantly improves region exploration.

fire_crystal.name: fire crystal
fire_crystal.description: Elemental fire captured in crystal form. Warm to the touch.
fire_crystal.use: Gift for salamanders (high value - elemental kinship)
fire_crystal.design_note: Enables full salamander befriending for players who lost their torch.

lore_tablets.name: lore tablets
lore_tablets.description: Stone tablets covered in ancient writing.

content.history: Story of the Meridian disaster and this region freezing
content.password: Full guardian password: 'Fire-that-gives-life and water-that-cleanses, united in purpose'
content.control_crystal: Mention that control crystal sleeps in eastern ice
content.observatory: Purpose of telescope - to see state of all regions

salamander_heated_stone.name: salamander-heated stone
salamander_heated_stone.description: A smooth stone that glows with warmth from salamander breath.
salamander_heated_stone.return_bonus: Returning stone to salamander grants +1 gratitude

cleaning_supplies.name: cleaning supplies
cleaning_supplies.description: Cloths and solutions for maintaining optical equipment.

hypothermia.description: Cold exposure causing progressive impairment and damage

acquisition.extreme_cold_zone: +20 severity per turn (cloak halves, gear ineffective)

thin_ice.detection: Visible on examination, or tracking skill reveals
thin_ice.breaking_through: Drowning rules apply + cold damage + hypothermia spike
thin_ice.safe_crossing: Test first, melt path, or find alternate route

commitment_system.description: Fewer direct NPC commitments in this region - primarily environmental challenges. Salamanders are the main social element but don't create urgent stakes.

salamander_commitment.note: Salamanders are elemental - not affected by hope, and not dying. No urgency.
salamander_commitment.fulfillment_bonus: +2 gratitude. All salamanders become friendly simultaneously.

withdrawal_response.dialog: The salamander tilts its head, flame flickering in its eyes. It makes a gesture toward the Hot Springs - showing where it will wait. No judgment, only patient warmth.

abandonment_effects.note: Cannot truly abandon - salamanders don't die from lack of player help
abandonment_effects.effect: Salamanders simply remain neutral. No penalty. No spread effects.
abandonment_effects.echo_reaction: None - The Echo doesn't comment on un-pursued elemental befriending

cross_region_commitments.description: Frozen Reaches is often a SOURCE of commitments made elsewhere
examples: Myconids request ice crystals - player must return here
Bee Queen wants frost lily - player must explore caves
Telescope reveals dying NPC elsewhere - creates urgency to help them
cross_region_commitments.design_principle: This region tests whether player keeps promises made in OTHER regions, and provides information that may create new urgency elsewhere.

effects.cold_tolerance: Wolves have natural fur - cold zones are comfortable, freezing zones uncomfortable
effects.in_extreme_cold: Observatory is too cold even for wolves. They wait at temple.

benefits.warmth_sharing: Sleeping with wolves reduces hypothermia gain by 20%

golem_interaction.combat: Wolves attack golems but do minimal damage (5 per hit, ineffective)
golem_interaction.territorial_avoidance: Wolves sense golem threat. Will not enter temple without player.
golem_interaction.exceptional_bravery: If player trapped/dying in temple, alpha may charge in (one-time rescue)

effects.general: Salamander is fire elemental - cold doesn't harm it but slows its movements
effects.in_ice_caves: Salamander actually helpful here - provides heat for item extraction

benefits.warmth_aura: Complete cold immunity for player when nearby
benefits.ice_melting: Can melt frozen items, clear ice blockages

salamander.home_region_note: This is salamander's native region. It's happy here.

other_salamander_interaction.if_companion_meets_others: Joyful reunion. Companion introduces player to others (+1 gratitude with all).
other_salamander_interaction.if_salamanders_hostile: Companion may convince others to stand down (trust check)

sira_specific.without_cold_gear: Suffers hypothermia same as player. 'This cold... it's unnatural.'
sira_specific.with_cold_gear: Can accompany throughout most of region
sira_specific.in_extreme_cold: Even with gear, can only survive briefly in observatory

aldric_specific.too_weak: Cannot handle cold exposure at all. Would die quickly.
aldric_specific.dialog: 'The cold places... I read about them. But I can't... please, don't ask me to go there.'

waiting_behavior.description: When companion cannot or won't enter an area
waiting_behavior.wolves_wait_at: Temple entrance or Hot Springs (whichever is closer)
waiting_behavior.return_behavior: Companions rejoin when player returns to waiting location

to_nexus.notes: Cold does not penetrate Nexus (magical barrier). Salamanders comfortable there.

temple_password_hint.note: Full password available in temple itself

cold_spread.trigger: Observatory telescope not repaired within turn threshold

effects.turn_75: Cold zones appear in Beast Wilds (high ground)
effects.turn_175: Some Sunken District water freezes (new routes, new hazards)

salamander_companion.behavior_when_blocked: Refuses at boundary, waits for player to return

information_revealed: NPC survival states (who is still alive, who needs help)

salamander_alliance.companion_available: One salamander can follow as companion
salamander_alliance.ongoing_benefit: Return visits to hot springs always welcomed

guardian_state.serving: Await orders, protect temple for player
guardian_state.destroyed: Temple unguarded, loot available but no protection benefit

narrative_role.core_tension: Hostile environment that rewards preparation and patience over urgency

contrast_with_other_regions.vs_sunken_district: No drowning NPCs, no frantic dual-rescue timing
contrast_with_other_regions.vs_beast_wilds: No dying cubs, no bleeding hunter - salamanders are fine without you
contrast_with_other_regions.vs_fungal_depths: No progressing infection to race against

player_experience.first_visit: Cold is scary, need to learn environment, find hot springs as sanctuary
player_experience.prepared_return: With gear/companion, methodical exploration becomes possible
player_experience.completion: Telescope reward provides strategic advantage for rest of game

temple_golems.ritual_offering: Resource gathering (fire item + hot springs water)

cold_survival.gear: Passive protection (cold weather gear, then cloak)
cold_survival.salamanders: Befriending (fire gifts, heated stone, eventual companion)
cold_survival.hot_springs: Strategic retreat (use as base, sally forth and return)

player_choices_matter: Fighting golems vs peaceful solution affects temple state
Befriending salamanders provides long-term cold immunity
Repairing telescope provides information advantage for all other regions
Thorough cave exploration finds control crystal (best golem solution)
Destroying guardians eliminates option for them to serve/protect

resolved_questions.question: How hard should extracting the crystal lens be?
resolved_questions.resolution: Requires: (1) Find it (visible in deep caves), (2) Have heat source (torch, heated stone, salamander, fire crystal), (3) Apply heat carefully. Breaking it destroys it permanently.

resolved_questions.question: Can player enter observatory without cold protection?
resolved_questions.resolution: Yes, but 5 turn limit before severe hypothermia (severity 100). Creates tension - explore quickly or prepare properly. With cloak: 15 turns. With salamander: unlimited.

resolved_questions.question: What does the observatory telescope reveal when repaired?
resolved_questions.resolution: Shows NPC states across all regions (general, not exact - 'movement in caves' not 'Garrett is at coordinates X,Y'). Also shows Spore Mother health, waystone requirements, hidden paths. Major strategic advantage.

resolved_questions.question: Are golems environmental hazards or combat encounters?
resolved_questions.resolution: Primarily puzzle encounters with multiple solutions. Combat IS possible but deliberately brutal - ~36 rounds for optimized player with good gear. Puzzle solutions clearly preferable.

resolved_questions.question: How many salamanders can become companions?
resolved_questions.resolution: Only one (the lead salamander). Others stay at hot springs but become friendly.

resolved_questions.question: What happens if player attacks salamanders?
resolved_questions.resolution: All three become hostile. If killed, hot springs lose their social element but remain functional as healing zone. No companion option. Echo may comment on senseless violence.

resolved_questions.question: What if player destroys guardians AND finds control crystal later?
resolved_questions.resolution: Crystal is useless - guardians are gone. Consequence of choosing combat.

resolved_questions.question: What if heated stone cools before player returns it?
resolved_questions.resolution: Salamander accepts cooled stone back (still counts for gratitude) but makes disappointed gesture. Slight relationship impact (-0.5 gratitude instead of +1).
